context: Ryan discusses whether and when to share Wisk Airline flight planning capabilities with SkyGrid, balancing product maturity, stakeholder interest, and comparative evaluation against existing tools like ForeFlight/Wiskey.

text.msg: What are your thoughts on sharing Wiskey Business with SkyGrid?
Lets chat when we next meet up at the SW Sync. I am just not seeing the value add on the flight planning side...
I think it would be good to demo at a specific point of maturity, after this meeting I have a capability threshold in mind that a demo would be productive enough
Given Phil's comments, I'm not sure that he's interested in FF directly... Trying to read the tea leaves here.

I've only used ForeFlight as a private pilot, and the capabilities are really designed for private pilots or 135s... Unless they have something different meant for scheduled carriers, I'm not sure how useful it is overall.
That's the impression I have as well... It will be interesting to see how it's pitched and what changes are planned to add fleet capabilities.

I need you to teach a master class on note taking during meetings. Looks great. Now just need to add some JIRA tasks...
If you have some time, I started a slide deck to explain nominal flight operations...

internal.thought: I want to avoid demoing too early; credibility matters more than exposure.
I ground my opinion in lived experience rather than abstract comparisons.
Publicly recognizing good work builds momentum and trust, then I redirect that energy toward execution.
